customization.account.need_upgrade: To use custom pages at the account level, you need to have at least 1 site on a paid plan. [Learn more](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200172706).
customization.error.full_url: Please provide a complete URL. Be sure to include http or https.
customization.headline: Custom Pages
customization.instructions: Build your custom page and host it online.
customization.required_tokens_descriptio:
The following token must be included in your custom page:

- **%{tokens}**
customization.subheadline: Personalize the error and challenge pages that Cloudflare presents to your visitors.
1000_errors.description: Customize the error page your visitors will see when a 1000 class error occurs.
1000_errors.help:
#### How do I customize my 1000 Class Errors page?
To customize your 1000 Class Errors page, design your custom HTML page and make sure to include the required token. Then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard 1000 Class Errors page to your visitors. **The maximum customized page size is 1.5 MB**.

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note**: Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.

#### What token is required in my custom 1000 Class Errors page?
To customize your 1000 Class Error page, you must include the following token on your custom HTML:

**::CLOUDFLARE_ERROR_1000S_BOX::**

This token ensures that diagnostic information will appear on your custom error page allowing support teams to identify issues quickly.

The following diagnostic information and text will always appear with your custom 1000 Class Errors page:

**Diagnostic information**:
Ray ID: 000000000000000
Timestamp: Thu, 01-Jan-70 00:00:00 GMT
Your IP address: 1.1.1.1
Requested URL: example.url/foo
Error reference number: 1001
Server ID: FL_FOO
User-Agent: Example User Agent

**Text**:
Error 1001
DNS resolution error

You've requested a page on a website (cloudflarepreview.com) that is on the Cloudflare network. Cloudflare is currently unable to resolve your requested domain (cloudflarepreview.com). There are two potential causes of this:

**Most likely**: If the owner just signed up for Cloudflare it can take a few minutes for the website's information to be distributed to our global network.
**Less likely**: Something is wrong with this site's configuration. Usually this happens when accounts have been signed up with a partner organization (e.g., a hosting provider) and the provider's DNS fails.

**Note**: The header and messaging will change based on the type of 1000 error.

[Learn more about 1000 errors](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/4425107232525).
1000_errors.title: 1000 Class Errors
500_errors.description: Customize the error page your visitors will see when a 500 class error occurs.
500_errors.help:
#### How do I customize my 500 Class Errors page?
To customize your 500 Class Errors page, design your custom HTML page and make sure to include the required token. Then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard 500 Class Errors page to your visitors on 502, 504, and 52x errors. **The maximum customized page size is 1.5 MB**.

500, 501, 503, and 505 responses **will not** trigger custom error pages to avoid breaking specific API endpoints and other web applications. Typically, custom errors should be reserved for cases where the origin server could not return a response for the request (520-526 errors).

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note:** Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.

#### What token is required in my custom 500 Class Errors page?

**::CLOUDFLARE_ERROR_500S_BOX::**

This token ensures that diagnostic information will appear on your custom error page allowing support teams to identify issues quickly.

The following diagnostic information and text will always appear with your custom 500 Class Errors page:

**Diagnostic information**:
Ray ID: 1df54f578987b9ec013
Your IP address: 1.1.1.1
Error reference number: 522
Cloudflare Location: San Jose

**Text**:
The initial connection between Cloudflare's network and the origin web server timed out. As a result, the web page can not be displayed.

**Note**: The header and messaging text will change based on the type of 500 error.

[Learn more about 500 errors](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115003011431).
500_errors.title: 500 Class Errors
ip_block.description: Customize the error page shown to your visitors when they visit from a blocked IP address or country.
ip_block.help:
#### How do I customize my IP/Country Block page?
To customize your IP/Country Block page, design your custom HTML page, then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard IP Block page to your visitors.

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note:** Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.

#### What token is available for my custom IP Block page?

**::CLIENT_IP::**

**::RAY_ID::**

**::GEO::**

These token provides diagnostic information such as Client's IP, Ray ID and Geographical Location that will appear on your custom error page, allowing support teams to identify issues quickly.
ip_block.title: IP/Country Block
waf_block.description: Customize the error page presented to your visitors when they trigger a Web Application Firewall rule.
waf_block.help:
#### How do I customize my WAF Block page?
To customize your WAF Block page, design your custom HTML page, then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard WAF Block page to your visitors.

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note:** Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.
waf_block.title: WAF Block
origin_error_page_pass_thru.description: When Origin Error Page is set to u201COnu201D, Cloudflare will proxy the 502 and 504 error pages directly from the origin.
origin_error_page_pass_thru.help:
#### What are Origin Error Pages?
This feature allows the customer to display the 5xx error pages set on the origin, rather than showing the default Cloudflare error page.

**Note:** Only for 5xx class errors (excluding 521 and 522 errors)
origin_error_page_pass_thru.title: Enable Origin Error Pages
always_online_error.description: Customize the error page your visitors will see when Always Online does not have a cached copy of the requested page.
always_online_error.help:
#### How do I customize my Always Online Error page?
To customize your Always Online Error page, design your custom HTML page and make sure to include the required token. Then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard Always Online Error page to your visitors.

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note:** Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.

#### What token is required in my custom Always Online Error page?
**::ALWAYS_ONLINE_NO_COPY_BOX::**

This token is replaced by a message explaining that Always Online does not have a cached copy of the requested page.

**Note:** The token is a unique piece of text you include in your custom HTML that will be replaced by specific Cloudflare pre-defined modules on your published page.
always_online_error.title: Always Onlineu2122 Error
basic_challenge.description: Customize the Interactive Challenge page presented to your visitors.
basic_challenge.help:
#### How do I customize my Interactive Challenge page?
To customize your Interactive Challenge page, design your custom HTML page and make sure to include the required token. Then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard Interactive Challenge page to your visitors. **The maximum customized page size is 1.5 MB**.

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note**: Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.

#### What token is required in my custom Interactive Challenge page?
To customize your Interactive Challenge page, you must include the following token on your custom HTML:

**::CAPTCHA_BOX::**

The CAPTCHA_BOX token embeds the CAPTCHA on your custom Interactive Challenge page.
basic_challenge.title: Interactive Challenge
managed_challenge.title: Managed Challenge / I'm Under Attack Modeu2122

country_challenge.description: Customize the challenge page presented to visitors from countries you have selected to block.

#### How do I customize my Country Challenge page?
To customize your Country Challenge page, design your custom HTML page and make sure to include the required token. Then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard Country Challenge page to your visitors. **The maximum customized page size is 1.5 MB**.

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note**: Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.

#### What token is required in my custom Country Challenge page?
To customize your Country Challenge page, you must include the following token on your custom HTML:

**::CAPTCHA_BOX::**

The CAPTCHA_BOX token embeds the CAPTCHA on your custom Country Challenge page.

**::CLIENT_IP::**

**::RAY_ID::**

**::GEO::**

This token provides diagnostic information such as Client's IP, Ray ID and Geographical Location that will appear on your custom error page.
country_challenge.title: Country Challenge
under_attack.description: Customize the JavaScript Challenge page presented to your visitors.
under_attack.help:
#### How do I customize my JavaScript Challenge page?
To customize your JavaScript Challenge page, design your custom HTML page and make sure to include the required token. Then host it online (it may be hosted anywhere). Once you publish your custom page, Cloudflare will use your customized page instead of serving our standard JavaScript Challenge page to your visitors. **The maximum customized page size is 1.5 MB**.

You can preview your customized page as it will appear to your visitors before publishing.

**Note**: Once you add the URL and click u201CPublishu201D, Cloudflare will store your custom page on our servers. You **do not** need to host your custom page after it has been published.#### What token is required in my custom JavaScript Challenge page?
To customize your JavaScript Challenge page, you must include the following token on your custom HTML:

**::IM_UNDER_ATTACK_BOX::**

The following text will always appear with your custom JavaScript Challenge page:

Checking your browser before accessing example.com
This process is automatic. Your browser will redirect to your requested content shortly.
Please allow up to 5 seconds.
under_attack.title: JavaScript Challenge
rate_limit.description: Customize the response presented to your visitors when they have triggered rate limiting.
rate_limit.title: 429 errors
